contextId.information: The number seven is a symbol of completeness and perfection.  The "seven spirits" refers either to the Spirit of God or to seven spirits who serve God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
These stars are symbols. They appear to represent the seven angels of the seven churches. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
The lampstands are symbols that represent the seven churches. See how you translated "lampstand" in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:01:12|1:12]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

This refers to the sword in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:01:14|1:16]]. Although symbols in apocalyptic language are normally not to be translated, translators may choose whether or not to explain this symbol as a symbol of God's word, as the UDB does. This symbol indicates that Christ will defeat his enemies by giving a simple command. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
contextId.quote: with the sword in my mouth

contextId.information: This is a bright star that appears early in the morning just before dawn. It was a symbol of victory. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

"Babylon the large city" or "the important city of Babylon." This was probably a symbol for the city of Rome, which was large, wealthy, and sinful. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

This is a symbol for participating in her sexually immoral passion.  AT: "to be sexually immoral like her" or "to get drunk like her in sexual sin"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
contextId.quote: to drink the wine of her immoral passion

contextId.information: Drinking the wine of God's wrath is a symbol for being punished by God. AT: "will also drink some of the wine that represents God's wrath"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
contextId.quote: will also drink some of the wine of God's wrath

contextId.information: This means that the wine is mixed only with different wines, and no water is mixed into it. It is strong, and a person who drinks much of it will get very drunk. As a symbol, it means that God will be extremely angry, not just a little angry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
